intro: Carum howellii, commonly known as Howell's caraway, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a strong, spicy scent. Carum howellii is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
